aberration.def: a deviation from what is normal or expected

acrimonious.def: (typically of speech or discussion) angry and bitter

ambiguous.def: open to more than one interpretation

ambivalent.def: having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone

amorphous.def: without a clearly defined shape or form; shapeless

anomalous.def: deviating from what is standard, normal, or expected

anomaly.def: something that deviates from what is standard, normal, or expected

belie.def: fail to give a true impression of (something); misrepresent

bottleneck.def: a situation that causes a delay in a process

calumny.def: making of a false statement meant to injure a person's reputation; slander

censure.def: express severe disapproval of (someone or something), especially in a formal statement

commensurate.def: corresponding in size or degree; in proportion

egregious.def: outstandingly bad or shocking in an obvious way

enervate.def: make (someone) feel drained of energy or vitality

equivocal.def: open to more than one interpretation; ambiguous

evasive.def: tending to avoid commitment, especially by responding only indirectly

extant.def: still in existence (usually refers to documents)

frugal.def: not spending much money (but spending wisely)

galvanize.def: excite or inspire (someone) into taking action

gregarious.def: to be likely to socialize with others

harangue.def: a lengthy and aggressive speech; tirade
lecture (someone) at length in an aggressive and critical manner

iconoclast.def: a person who attacks cherished beliefs or institutions

ingenuous.def: (of a person or action) innocent and naive

intimate.def: (of knowledge) obtained from a lot of studying or experience

laconic.def: (of a person, speech, or style of writing) using very few words

maintain.def: state something strongly to be the case

mercurial.def: (of a person) prone to sudden or unpredictable changes in mood

miser.def: a person who hoards wealth and spends as little money as possible

mutation.def: the way in which genes change and produce permanent differences

parsimonious.def: very unwilling to spend money or use resources

parochial.def: narrowly restricted in scope or outlook

prevaricate.def: speak or act in an evasive way

prodigal.def: spending money or resources recklessly; wastefully extravagant

profligate.def: recklessly extravagant or wasteful in the use of resources
someone who spends money recklessly or wastefully

qualify.def: make (a statement or assertion) less absolute

tirade.def: a long, angry speech of criticism or accusation

undermine.def: lessen the effectiveness gradually or insidiously

venal.def: showing or motivated by susceptibility to bribery; corrupt

vindicate.def: clear (someone) of blame or suspicion with supporting proof
